required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Post Sexual Assault Stress
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Postrape Drug Abuse: Replication Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether a brief intervention in video format, that includes education about reactions to assault and modeling of adaptive coping strategies, designed to reduce post assault drug use or abuse and PTSD and shown to recent victims of sexual assault at the time of receipt of post assault medical care is associated with better post-assault outcomes as compared to a comparable length video that includes pleasant imagery and relaxation instruction or standard care.

detailed_description.textblock: Post assault outcomes include coping behaviors and PTSD symptoms.

primary_outcome.description: total possible scores range from 0 - 10 with higher scores indicating poor functioning, post assault at 6 months
Total scores range from 0 - 40 with higher scores indicating greater problem severity, post assault at 6 months

primary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days preceding 6 week, 3 month and 6 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: quantity in 14 days prior to 6 week, 3 month and 6 month follow-up

primary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days prior to 6 week, 3 month, 6 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: estimated number of drinks during the 14 days prior to each follow-up assessment

primary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days prior to 6 week, 3 month, 6 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Number of days of use within the 14 days prior to follow-up assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days prior to 6 week, 3 month, 6 month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Any reported use of cocaine or other illicit drugs other than marijuana in the 14 days prior to follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-medical Use of Prescription Drugs Frequency
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days prior to 6 week, 3 month, 6 month follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days of use within the 14 days prior to follow-up assessment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks prior to 6 week, 3 month, 6 month followup
secondary_outcome.description: Total scores range from 0 to 51 with higher scores indicating greater frequency of symptoms, Measure of PTSD symptoms.

arm_group.description: Prevention of post sexual assault stress

intervention.description: Video including information psychoeducation and modeling of adaptive behavioral coping strategies for use post-assault. Shown at time of post assault medical exam.
Video containing pleasant imagery and relaxation instruction information. Shown at time of post assault medical exam.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Seeking medical care after recent sexual assault
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active psychosis Active suicidality Cognitive impairment Non-English speaking Severe injury

reported_events.desc: Cause of death and cause of hospitalization unknown

event.description: unanticipated, unlikely/unrelated to study - no information about cause, identified over course of study and not related to study procedures

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
